questions.question: I won’t let you …………………
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: He didn’t allow me …………………… for the drink.
questions.description: Allow is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: You ought .................. peace with him.
questions.description: Ought is followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: He quit his job because they made him …………………….. overtime.
questions.description: When made is used in the active voice, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: He was made ……………………… harder and harder.
questions.description: When made is in the passive voice, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: He is capable ……………………. the problem on his own.
questions.description: Capable is followed by of + ing form.

questions.question: You must not ……………………… this secret to anyone.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after modals.

questions.question: I forgot .................... the door.
questions.description: Forget is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: You don't need ....................... about me.
questions.description: When need is used as an ordinary verb, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: You need not …………………… for my drinks.
questions.description: When need is an auxiliary verb, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I was forced .......................
questions.description: Force is followed by an infinitive with to.
